title: Add a refined Kendo UI Mobile implementation
body:
The new Kendo UI Mobile promises that the same UI code would render Androidish on Android and iOSish on iOS. ( http://www.kendoui.com/mobile.aspx ) I'm not sure if the current Kendo UI Mobile implementation uses this feature to its full extent. It'd probably worth a look. Thank you.

Also, to avoid confusion, please refer to this framework as "Kendo UI Mobile" on the page. ("Kendo UI" is a suite that contains an other JS UI solution as well.)

title: Add Lavaca to the website

milestone.title: v1.3 release
milestone.description: Address some of the consistency issues - add infinite scroll to the spec? tabbed navigation?

title: Search input widget changes unexpectedly when clicking Go (Galaxy S2)
body:
Strange behaviour on search text input widget on Galaxy S2.

Steps:
1. Open PropertyCross Android JQuery Mobile version
2. Tap on search text input widget
3. Type 'west'. The Samsung Keyboard suggests Westminster as one of the alternatives.
4. Tap on the Westminster suggestion. Text input widget now says 'Westminster'
5. Tap 'Go' button

Expected behaviour:
6. Search on 'Westminster' is performed

Actual behaviour:
6. Text input widget content reverts back to 'west'. Search on 'west' is performed, producing a list of locations starting with 'west'


I haven't seen this kind of behaviour in any other application / situation which I believe is an indication of an issue specific to PropertyCross.

milestone.title: v1.3 release

title: Search should be initiated when the soft 'return' key is pressed
body: If you type in a search team ten hit enter on the soft keyboard, the search should be executed.

title: The search results list maintains selection state between searches
body:
To reproduce, search for ne1, select the third search result, then navigate back to the 'home' screen. Next, search for ne2. When the app navigates to the search results screen, you will see that the table view already has the third item selected.

Selection is being used for navigation so should be transient.

title: Delphi configuration issues
body:
Just a few minor issues ...

+ The application name should be called 'PropertyCross' - I cannot see where to change that?
+ The splashscreen and icons have been changd to teh PropertyCross 'standard', but the path is absolute. What token do you use for relative paths?
+ The icon should be 'pre-rendered', ie. no 'gloss' layer. Is there a setting for that?

title: jqMobile android theme
body:
How about http://nativedroid.godesign.ch/ for an android theme?

I think the code sharing stats are a bit off for jqMobile at the moment - the default iOS theme doesn't suit android, so shouldn't really be counted as shared code?

title: Add a Dojo implementation
body: Dojo has mobile support: http://dojotoolkit.org/features/mobile

title: Android back button not correctly supported
body:
With Android the hardware back button should navigate back to the previous screen. 

(In PhoneGap wrapped apps this means you need to handle the backbutton event)

title: Enyo build does not copy across the config.xml PGBuild file
body:
The Enyo build is nice and simple - and documented here:

https://github.com/tastejs/PropertyCross/blob/master/enyo/deploy.md

However, the build does not copy the config.xml file into the deploy folder. It probably should, as this would make PG packaging easier.

title: Sencha submodule for PG Build is not working
body:
```
fatal: reference is not a tree: 0d9cb68d3ac14554b49581c101e20cb888805b2d
Unable to checkout '0d9cb68d3ac14554b49581c101e20cb888805b2d' in submodule path
'senchatouch2/build/package'
```

Basically, I don't think this approach is scalable. I think we should remove all the repos that are used for building using PhoneGap and come up with a more scalable solution - see #180

title: Add Appery.io Implementation
Cannot type in search textbox on android
body: I installed the lungojs sample on three android devices. the text box to enter search location does not work (keyboard does not get pulled up). is there a specific version of android that it works with.meanwhile on all three, the phonejs sample works

title: Android version has exactly the same look and feel as the iOS version
body:
The specification states that the look and feel of each of the target platforms should be matched. Implementations that exhibit this issue have the same look and feel for both Android and iOS.

It is worth noting that the PropertyCross team are not saying that this approach to cross-platform development is right or wrong. When writing the specification, the choice to adopt the relevant platform's look and feel was made simply because we feel that this is what most people will want to do right now.

It's also worth noting that some of the implementation, like mgwt, try to tailor the UI to make it more Android-like, but with little success.

title: RhoMobile - geolocation based searches do not work.
RhoMobile - previous search term is forgotten
body: If you perform a search, then return to the 'home' page the previous search text should still be present in the input field. With RhoMobile this is empty.

title: RhoMobile - recent searches are not displayed
body: The 'recent searches' specification feature has not been implemented.

title: The implementation does not provide a 'fixed' header
body:
The specification mentions that the aim of PropertyCross is to mimic the look and feel of the various platforms (iOS, Android ...).

For iOS the standard UI has a header (UINavigationBar) and a content area. When the content area scrolls the header remains fixed at the top of the screen.

This issue indicates that for the given frameworks, that the header scrolls with the content.

On an implementation note, this is not a trivial task for an HTML5 app, most mobile web browser do not provide support for fixed position elements. Complex solutions such as iScroll exist:

http://cubiq.org/iscroll-4

title: Should the specification allow infinite scrolling?
body:
Currently the PhoneJS implementation has infinite scrolling. I allowed this through the review process, even though it is not per-spec, because I am starting to change my mind about this area of the specification. It is such a popular feature, and many of these frameworks do support it, that I think the spec should be flexible here. 

See for example the Enyo pull request:

https://github.com/ColinEberhardt/PropertyCross/pull/184

The Enyo team want to use pull-to-load-more too.

title: Standardise the build system
body:
Some projects use the PGBuild maven approach, some use a github 'mirror' repo for PGB, others just expect you to zip the contents, other (PhoneJS) have a build script that creats the release package.

Should we standardise?

title: jQM implementation has a complex build due to the need to remove require.js
body:
The current jQM implementation uses PhoneGap Build, however, we have found that RequireJS is not compatible with PGB. As a result, the jQM implementation has a complex build.

Perhaps we should not use RequireJS in order to simplify the code?

title: Standardise the config.xml files
body: Many of the projects use PhoneGap Build, and so have a config.xml file. There should be a standard template for these.

title: AngularJs support
body: Angular is rapidly gaining popularity, it'd be very nice to see how it fits in.  Additionally to see if you can easily add your own UI/mobile touch layer on top of Angular's foundation.
